synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blunt Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, alongside guest Garrett, delve into the complexities of body image and the gym. They share personal stories, discuss the impact of societal standards, and emphasize the importance of self-acceptance and enjoying physical activity for mental well-being.
quotes: The horror is persistent, but so do we.
You have to get into the thick of it to get out again.
If you don't have that passion or drive to go to the gym, find something active that you are passionate about.
Comparison is the thief of joy, but it's also the thief of progress in your body image.
The whole point of going to the gym is to put your body under stress so it creates a change.
If you're going to the gym to improve the way you look, you should also be going to the gym because you enjoy it.
It's important to not hyper-fixate on minor insecurities; it can turn you kind of crazy trying to fix them.
You shouldn't look at a fitness influencer and say, 'I should be looking like that.'
Everyone is trying their best; we all have our struggles.
Drink more water; it will improve your physical and mental health.
